meanings.definition: The act of assembling or gathering together in a mass.
meanings.sent1: The massing of students in the schoolyard was a sight to see.
meanings.sent2: The massing of clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The massing of ingredients in the recipe made for a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: The massing of protesters in the square was a powerful display of unity.
meanings.sent5: The massing of colors in the painting created a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The process of forming a mass or masses.
meanings.sent1: The massing of data for the report took hours of work.
meanings.sent2: The massing of snow on the mountain peak was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent3: The massing of toys in the playroom made it look like a toy store.
meanings.sent4: The massing of stars in the night sky was a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The massing of books on the shelf made it look like a mini library.

meanings.definition: The act of combining elements to form a whole.
meanings.sent1: The massing of flavors in the dish created a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: The massing of bricks in the construction site was progressing well.
meanings.sent3: The massing of ideas in the brainstorming session led to a creative solution.
meanings.sent4: The massing of players in the team formed a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The massing of sounds in the orchestra produced a harmonious melody.
